text: beObank, nv/SA/AG is a Belgian bank owned by a French financial conglomerate Crédit Mutuel Nord Europe. As of 2013, the company offers everyday banking products (current accounts, loans, credit cards, etc.) through the network of 192 branches across Belgium. ==History== "'City Bank of New York was opened in Brussels in 1919 and continued its operations until World War II. In 1962, Citibank reopened its banking facilities in Brussels. In 1969, Citibank took over Crédivit Bank and Financia Bank. Crédivit merged with Financia to form Famibank in 1977. After taking over Banque Copine and Banque Sud Belge Banque Sud Belge merged with Famibank, creating Citibank Belgium in 1992. In 2012 the Citibank consumer franchise was sold to Credit Mutuel Nord Europe. In March 2013, Citibank Belgium (Citibank Belgique, Citibank België) was rebranded to Beobank NV/SA. ==External links== * Beobank.be Home page * Annual report 2012 English version * Annual report 2012 French version Category:Banks of Belgium
title: Beobank
